Text: If the LORD had not been on our side—let Israel now declare—
Context: A call for God's people to acknowledge the help of the LORD.

Text: if the LORD had not been on our side when men rose up against us,
Context: Reiteration emphasizing reliance on God against adversaries.

Text: then they would have swallowed us alive in their burning anger against us.
Context: Describes potential destruction indicating deep distress.

Text: then the waters would have engulfed us, the torrent would have overwhelmed us,
then the raging waters would have swept us away.
Context: Continues the metaphor of being overwhelmed by adversities.

Text: Praise be to the LORD, who has not let us be torn by their teeth.
Context: Expresses thankfulness for God's deliverance from enemies.

Text: We have escaped like a bird from the fowler’s snare; the snare has been broken, and we have escaped.
Context: Compares deliverance to a bird escaping captivity, symbolizing freedom and salvation.

Text: Our help is in the name of the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
Context: Affirms reliance on God, recognizing His sovereign power and ability to aid.
